alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 3:38PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Baldwin, northwestern Santa Rosa and central Escambia Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 337 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Molino to 3 miles northwest of Gonzalez to 10 miles north of Lillian. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ferry Pass, Ensley, Gonzalez, Pace, Molino and Floridatown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
